intro: Paepalanthus elongatus var. helichrysoides, commonly known as the yellow-flowered papyrus plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, yellowish flowers that appear in dense clusters. It typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland conservation efforts.
